body: It's sad, the vigil. More so because r_c knows {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} should care and doesn't, than any grief for m_c.
r_c refuses to sit vigil for m_c. {PRONOUN/m_c/subject/CAP} failed r_c as a parent, guardian, and mentor. Why should r_c honor {PRONOUN/m_c/object} now?
r_c is called to m_c's vigil, but declines to speak. {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP}{VERB/r_c/'re/'s} not sure {PRONOUN/r_c/subject}'d have anything good to say.
They may have shared blood, but nothing more. r_c doesn't show up to m_c's vigil.
Maybe in a deep-rooted hatred of {PRONOUN/m_c/object}, r_c is glad {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} doesn't have to see {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} parent, m_c, anymore.
r_c, with burning tears streaming from {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} eyes, yowls at m_c's cold body, hoping {PRONOUN/m_c/subject}{VERB/m_c/'s/'re} rotting in the depths of the Dark Forest.

r_c hisses until {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} throat is burnt and hoarse, believing m_c could hear {PRONOUN/r_c/object}. Why did {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} hate {PRONOUN/r_c/object} so much, yet brought {PRONOUN/r_c/object} into this life? {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} knows {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} will never have the answers.
Since birth, r_c was lectured countless times that {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} should always honor {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} parents. Pfft. m_c doesn't deserve such praises from {PRONOUN/r_c/object}.

It's a horrendous moment when a child outlives their parents. But, for r_c? {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} couldn't help but leer at m_c's body in {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} dirty grave. Here's to many moons without {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} parent.

m_c wasn't there for r_c. And now, r_c will never be there for {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} parent's death. Love was never reciprocated between the two of them, so it was easy and a breath of fresh air as r_c simply strolled by, ignoring the vigil.
no_body: It's sad, the vigil. More so because r_c knows {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} should care and doesn't, than any grief for m_c.
r_c refuses to sit vigil for m_c. {PRONOUN/m_c/subject/CAP} failed r_c as a parent, guardian, and mentor. Why should r_c honor {PRONOUN/m_c/object} now?
r_c is called to m_c's vigil, but declines to speak. {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP}{VERB/r_c/'re/'s} not sure {PRONOUN/r_c/subject}'d have anything good to say.
They may have shared blood, but nothing more. r_c doesn't show up to m_c's vigil.
Without m_c's sneering and berating anymore, r_c blows a sigh of relief; {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/is/are} no longer under the control of {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} parent.

Even if m_c's body was never found, lost within the secrets of what took {PRONOUN/m_c/object}, r_c couldn't help but sneak a glimpse over {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} shoulder, frightened that m_c is watching from the shadows...

r_c scoffs at the thought that m_c lays in an unknown grave out in the wilderness, insisting it was too good for {PRONOUN/m_c/object}. But at least for r_c, {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} don't have to pretend to weep over a body the Clan couldn't find.
